summary:
35 years of experience and still learning. I enjoy finding ways to apply and share that experience. Life moves on and I now have the time to return to business situations where I can do that.

I bring extensive knowledge of contracting, procurement and project strategy both through direct delivery and indirectly mentoring, coaching and training.

Importantly I don't see knowledge and experience as static assets - they need to be adapted and extended to new situations. I enjoy challenging assumptions and paradigms including my own.

This knowledge ranges from the petrochemical industry to Public Procurement of major projects.

I maintain a keen interest in the changing world and the opportunities it brings.

profile_positions.description:
Overlapping my work as a consultant and growing into possibly the most challenging job I have ever had.

Not a period completely devoid of other activities. I spent time teaching English to children in a Leonardo school - an initiative for gifted children in basis school and translated a guide to Breda Cathedral. Currently I sit on the parents advisory board for bilingual education for a high school.

I've become a very good cook and I like entertaining. 


Learning

Negotiating with ruthlessly objective children whilst mentoring and guiding them!
And becoming a pretty good cook if I say so myself.

profile_positions.description:
The start of a young family and the need to be at home more led me to extended my experience in consulting developed in the NAM to various projects in the Netherlands. This included mentoring managers and teams in addition to strategy and implementation.

Major involvements

Co-author a review of the N31 PPP project. This is a design, build, maintain project initiated by Rijkswaterstaat. 

Mentored the Project Manager of a PPP project to refurbish the Ministry of Finance building in Den Haag.

Authored the Project closeout review for the HSL Infrastructure project

Conducted a review on future procurement objectives for a division of Shell and developed a strategy for the procurement function.

Learning

Mentoring skills
Public procurement processes

profile_positions.description:
I was offered a post aimed at both supporting commercial and business strategies development across multiple business units and developing the personnel to implement these.


Key responsibilities

Training and coaching of selected staff in business analysis, contract and negotiation  strategy and project and contract management.

Development of major contract and supply chain initiatives and the teams and techniques necessary for implementation

Major successes

Project managed the introduction of a e-procurement process for NAM.

Facilitated the introduction of an integrated contract and SCM strategy for the well construction portfolio. A value creation strategy to challenge rather than respond to the market. A multi discipline project covering activities with an annual  value in excess of $500 Million. Significant savings were achieved and the approach taken up by other Shell companies.

Learning

Consultancy skills 
Development of training skills
Deepened business analysis skills
